column5: Macaulay Library Audio and Video Collection
column7: The Macaulay Library is the world's largest and oldest scientific archive of biodiversity audio and video recordings. Our mission is to collect and preserve recordings of each species' behavior and natural history, to facilitate the ability of others to collect and preserve such recordings, and to actively promote the use of these recordings for diverse purposes spanning scientific research, education, conservation, and the arts.
column13:
Cite the source of recordings as Macaulay Library (ML).

When possible, include the following data in your citation:

ML Media-collection Catalog-number
Common Name - Scientific name
Recordist
Location
Date
Macaulay Library/Cornell

For example:

ML Audio 2081
Green Heron - Butorides virescens
Sutherland, Charles A
United States, New York, Tompkins, 3 km NE of Ithaca, Sapsucker Woods Pond
29 July 1962
Macaulay Library, www.macaulaylibrary.org
Cornell Lab of Ornithology

To cite an online recording, use the URL from the specimen record page. This URL is a stable globally unique identifier, or GUID, and also approximates the format for a life science identifier(LSID):

institution_collection_catalog#
(e.g. macaulaylibrary.org/video/12345).

The long url form should not be used.
(e.g. macaulaylibrary.org/video/12345/cardinal-new-york-2011).

For more information: http://macaulaylibrary.org/cite-recordings
column88: Arfak Mountains, Vogelkop Peninsula, Island of New Guinea
column140: Indonesia; Papua; ; Arfak Mountains, Vogelkop Peninsula, Island of New Guinea
